Type: Upper-body aerobic (arm-crank ergometer, wheelchair-propulsion intervals, FES-cycling)
RestPeriod: Brief 1–2-min breaks every 5–10 min; avoid >48 h between sessions
Progression: Add 3–5 min per session every 2 weeks if no post-exercise fatigue or autonomic dysreflexia
Supervision: Start in a climate-controlled gym with a physiotherapist; monitor blood pressure & skin integrity

Type: Progressive resistance training (shoulder, chest, back, arms, core)
Progression: Increase resistance ≤10 % when 12 reps are completed comfortably; emphasise slow concentric control
Supervision: Technique taught by a physiotherapist to prevent shoulder overuse and monitor spasticity

Type: Flexibility & ROM (shoulders, wrists, hip flexors, hamstrings)
Progression: Extend stretch holds to 30 s; add dynamic shoulder mobility or trunk rotations as tolerated
Supervision: Follow an individualised home programme; perform pressure-relief every 30 min when seated
